tn.text: the name of the chief commander of the armies of Assyria (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
the name of the king of Assyria

tn.ref: he fought against Ashdod and took it
tn.text: Ashdod refers to the army of Ashdod. AT: "he fought against the army of Ashdod and defeated it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"walking around without clothes and without sandals." Here the word "naked" probably refers to wearing only his undergarments.
The place names refer to their people. AT: "concerning the people of Egypt and the people of Ethiopia" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the king of Assyria will lead away the captives
tn.text: The king orders his army to do this task. AT: "the king of Assyria will have his army lead away the captives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: will lead away the captives of Egypt, and the exiles of Ethiopia
tn.text: It can be stated clearly that they will first attack and capture people. AT: "will attack Egypt and Ethiopia and capture their people and lead them away" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Egypt refers to the people of Egypt. AT: "which will bring shame on the people of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: because of Ethiopia their hope and of Egypt their glory
tn.text: Hope and glory refer to their trust in the military power of these countries. AT: "because they had trusted in the power of the armies of Ethiopia and Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
the people who lived in the lands bordering the Mediterranean Sea

tn.ref: where we fled for help to be rescued
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "where we fled to so they would rescue us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: and now, how can we escape?
tn.text: The author uses this question to emphasize how hopeless their situation was. AT: "Now there is no way for us to escape!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
